intro: Arrabidaea corallina, commonly known as the coralbean, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, round fruits that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed areas and along roadsides. The botanical features of Arrabidaea corallina make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
